ZeroOneDists 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

The Unit-Power Half-Normal family

Source: R/UPHN.R
UPHN.Rd

The function UPHN() defines the Unit-Power Half-Normal distribution, a two parameter distribution, for a gamlss.family object to be used in GAMLSS fitting using the function gamlss().

UPHN(mu.link = "log", sigma.link = "log")

Arguments

mu.link

defines the mu.link, with "log" link as the default for the mu parameter.

sigma.link

defines the sigma.link, with "log" link as the default for the sigma.

Value

Returns a gamlss.family object which can be used to fit a COMPO distribution in the gamlss() function.

Details

The UPHN distribution with parameters \(\mu\) and \(\sigma\) has a support in \((0, 1)\) and density given by

\(f(x| \mu, \sigma) = \frac{2\mu}{\sigma x^2} \phi(\frac{1-x}{\sigma x}) (2 \Phi(\frac{1-x}{\sigma x})-1)^{\mu-1}\)

for \(0 < x < 1\), \(\mu > 0\) and \(\sigma > 0\).

References

Santoro, K. I., Gómez, Y. M., Soto, D., & Barranco-Chamorro, I. (2024). Unit-Power Half-Normal Distribution Including Quantile Regression with Applications to Medical Data. Axioms, 13(9), 599.

See also

dUPHN.

Author

Juan Diego Suarez Hernandez, jsuarezhe@unal.edu.co

Examples

# Example 1
# Generating random values with
# known mu and sigma
require(gamlss)
mu <- 1.5
sigma <- 4.0

y <- rUPHN(1000, mu, sigma)

mod1 <- gamlss(y~1, sigma.fo=~1,  family=UPHN,
               control=gamlss.control(n.cyc=5000, trace=TRUE))
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 1: Global Deviance = 1504.177 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 2: Global Deviance = -1086.079 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 3: Global Deviance = -1387.416 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 4: Global Deviance = -1427.159 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 5: Global Deviance = -1432.549 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 6: Global Deviance = -1433.232 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 7: Global Deviance = -1433.316 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 8: Global Deviance = -1433.318 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 9: Global Deviance = -1433.315 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 10: Global Deviance = -1433.313 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 11: Global Deviance = -1433.312 

exp(coef(mod1, what="mu"))
#> (Intercept) 
#>    1.456473 
exp(coef(mod1, what="sigma"))
#> (Intercept) 
#>    4.081422 

# Example 2
# Generating random values under some model

# A function to simulate a data set with Y ~ UPHN
gendat <- function(n) {
  x1 <- runif(n)
  x2 <- runif(n)
  mu <- exp(0.75 - 0.69 * x1)   # Approx 1.5
  sigma <- exp(0.5 - 0.64 * x2) # Approx 1.20
  y <- rUPHN(n, mu, sigma)
  data.frame(y=y, x1=x1, x2=x2)
}

dat <- gendat(n=2000)

mod2 <- gamlss(y~x1, sigma.fo=~x2, family=UPHN, data=dat,
               control=gamlss.control(n.cyc=5000, trace=TRUE))
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 1: Global Deviance = -1821.433 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 2: Global Deviance = -1858.437 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 3: Global Deviance = -1864.227 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 4: Global Deviance = -1865.16 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 5: Global Deviance = -1865.36 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 6: Global Deviance = -1865.406 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 7: Global Deviance = -1865.418 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 8: Global Deviance = -1865.422 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 9: Global Deviance = -1865.423 
#> GAMLSS-RS iteration 10: Global Deviance = -1865.424 

summary(mod2)
#> Warning: summary: vcov has failed, option qr is used instead
#> ******************************************************************
#> Family:  c("UPHN", "Unit-Power Half-Normal") 
#> 
#> Call:  gamlss(formula = y ~ x1, sigma.formula = ~x2, family = UPHN,
